intro: Agoseris carnea, commonly known as the pink evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Agoseris carnea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
